description: This graduate module looks at evolving China- Southeast Asia relationship in both a global and regional perspective, taking into account new variables like enhanced economic linkages between them, growing connectivity projects and their challenges, geopolitical environment in East Asia, and their interactions with other major powers. The program will delve into both opportunities and challenges facing the regional integration of China and the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), along with the interactions among various strategies and initiatives hinging on Southeast Asia, such as China’s Belt and Road initiative, ASEAN’s Outlook on the Indo-Pacific, and the U.S. Indo-Pacific strategy.
title: Contemporary China-Southeast Asia Relations
